abstract: Frank Lautenberg and John D. Rockefeller have been critical of News Corporation and Rupert Murdoch in the past.
snippet: Frank Lautenberg and John D. Rockefeller have been critical of News Corporation and Rupert Murdoch in the past.
lead_paragraph: Two members of Congress are calling for government inquiries in the United States into the conduct of Rupert Murdoch’s News Corporation, which is enmeshed in a deepening hacking scandal in Britain.

headline.main: Congressmen Call for U.S. Investigation of News Corporation

abstract: Peter King is the first Republican to call for an inquiry into the company’s practices, including anonymous allegations that journalists tried to get phone information on 9/11 victims.
snippet: Peter King is the first Republican to call for an inquiry into the company’s practices, including anonymous allegations that journalists tried to get phone information on 9/11 victims.
lead_paragraph: Public criticism of the News Corporation’s conduct in the British hacking scandal has crossed the ocean to the United States — and crossed the floor to the Republican side — as half a dozen members of Congress urged the government to investigate possible misconduct, including violations of a law that guards against foreign corruption.

headline.main: Calls for Congress to Investigate the Conduct of the News Corporation
